body.p: To his Excellency Gov. B Magoffin

The undersigned citizens of Fulton & Hickman Counties would respectfully represent that about Seven years ago George Morrow was convicted in the Fulton circuit of Manslaughter (he having killed his own son) Morrow had been drunk for many years and we have no doubt but he was at the time deranged from the effects of whiskey. he has now been in the state prison about seven years we think sufficiently long to work a reformation in him. if possible to be done he is now about 65 years old and we believe & hope will never indulge in the use of whiskey again. We therefore respectfuly pray your Excellency to grant him a pardon for the remainder of his time and restore him to a large & helpless family

W. B. Alexander
